content.content: 1. For the purposes of subsection 40 (1) of the Act, a guardian of property or an attorney under a continuing power of attorney shall be entitled, subject to an increase under subsection 40 (3) of the Act or an adjustment pursuant to a passing of the guardian’s or attorney’s accounts under section 42 of the Act, to compensation of, (a) 3 per cent on capital and income receipts; (b) 3 per cent on capital and income disbursements; and (c) three-fifths of 1 per cent on the annual average value of the assets as a care and management fee.  O. Reg. 26/95, s. 1; O. Reg. 159/00, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. For the purposes of subsection 40 (1) of the Act, a guardian of property or an attorney under a continuing power of attorney shall be entitled, subject to an increase under subsection 40 (3) of the Act or an adjustment pursuant to a passing of the guardian’s or attorney’s accounts under section 42 of the Act, to compensation of,

(a) 3 per cent on capital and income receipts;

(b) 3 per cent on capital and income disbursements; and

(c) three-fifths of 1 per cent on the annual average value of the assets as a care and management fee.  O. Reg. 26/95, s. 1; O. Reg. 159/00, s. 1.
